key_title: Key to the families of Marchantiophyta

leads.lead_text: Plant a thick, pad-like and non-transparent thallus, internally organised into ventral storage tissue and dorsal air chambers, these rarely without roofing epidermis, usually with visible pores on the dorsal surface, at least when old, sometimes also with carpocephalum with air chambers
Plants with a thallus not internally organised into storage tissue and air chambers and without air pores, or deeply dissected into lobe-like segments or with clearly differentiated stem and leaves
Dorsal surface of thallus with gemmae in cups
Specialised asexual propagules absent

Gemmae cups crescent-shaped; archegoniophore a stalk terminated by four entire and tubular involucres arranged perpendicular to each other and spreading horizontally, appearing cross-like; pseudoperianth absent
Gemmae cups circular; archegoniophore terminated by an umbrella-shaped carpocephalum with lobes; bivalved and ciliate involucre and campanulate pseudoperianth between carpocephalum lobes
Thallus with a central furrow dorsally; capsule internal in thallus, not produced on an archegoniophore or in an involucre
Thallus not furrowed dorsally; capsule produced on an archegoniophore or a marginal bivalvate involucre
Thallus pouch-like around carpocephalum, dorsally with open air chambers formed by unistratose septa that lack roofing epidermis and air pores; oil cells absent; elaters absent
Thallus flat when hydrated, with archegoniophores absent or raising carpocephalum well above thallus; oil cells present; elaters present
Thallus with multiple tiers of air chambers; air chambers not floored by photosynthetic filaments; sporophyte produced on an archegoniophore well above the main thallus
Thallus with a single layer of air chambers; air chambers floored by photosynthetic filaments; sporophyte produced within a black bivalvate marginal involucre
Thallus without a prominent midrib, not dissected to near the midrib into lobes, multistratose except sometimes at margin
Thallus with a prominent midrib or predominantly unistratose or plants deeply dissected into lobe-like segments or with a stem and distinct leaves

Thallus on soil or epiphytic, lithophytic or on logs, in moist alpine, rainforest, forest or riparian habitats; sporophyte produced on short ventral or lateral branches or thallus margins, surrounded by a calyptra at base; dorsal surface of thallus without any structures that could be interpreted as vestigial leaves
Thallus half-buried in soil in seasonally dry habitats; sporophyte produced in marsupium buried in soil; dorsal surface near growing apex with two ranks of lamellae-like vestigial leaves
Thallus not dissected to near the midrib into lobe-like segments or if rarely with lobes, lobes inrolled, entirely saccate and with hairs on margins
Thallus dissected into non-saccate lobe-like segments without hairs, or small and wing-like from a stem-like base, or plants clearly differentiated into stem and leaves
Thallus with hairs along margins and often ventrally, rarely with saccate lobes
Thallus without hairs along margins or ventral surface, never lobed
Thallus with an erect stipe and a repetively forked frond section spreading horizontally; sporophytes produced on ventral surface of frond base
Thallus not dendroid, creeping over substrate or if dendroid, frond section funnel-shaped; sporophytes produced on upper surface of thallus or from the apex of a reduced branch near plant base
Sporophytes enclosed within flask-shaped inflated pseudoperianths with pores when mature; thallus a single wing to one side of stem or largely obscured by large and prominent pseudoperianths

Sporophytes not enclosed within a flask-shaped pseudoperianth at maturity; thallus dissected into several clearly visible segments not obscured by reproductive organs or plant differentiated into stem and leaves
Thallus a single dorsal wing; pseudoperianth along the stem alternating on either side of the thallus wing; spores spinose
Thallus with two rows of lateral segments, mostly obscured by large pseudoperianths; spores areolate
Plant forming a rosette of distinctly crisped or concave segments at base of sporophyte
Plant not forming a rosette of leaves around young sporophyte
Thallus without lamellae dorsally; rhizoids usually purple or crimson
Thallus with lamellae dorsally; rhizoids hyaline or brownish
Leaf-like segments multistratose throughout, with a crescentic adaxial lobule that is decurrent along stem-like axis
Leaves completely or mostly unistratose, without adaxial lobules or if with adaxial lobules not crescentic and decurrent along stem
Lateral leaves with abaxial lobules
Lateral leaves without lobules or with a fold between two lobes, with the smaller lobe resting on the adaxial surface of the larger abaxial lobe
Lobule an inflated sac, appearing to be unattached to leaf; minute filamentous to triangular stylus appendage attached beween lobule and stem
Lobule formed by a simple rolling or folding of the basiscopic leaf margin; stylus appendage absent
Lateral leaf margins entire; underleaves always explanate, never comprised of inflated sacs
Lateral leaf margins ciliate; underleaves on ultimate branches comprised of inflated sacs
Underleaves present, or if rarely present, rhizoids present in fascicles along stem where underleaves would be expected
Underleaves absent; rhizoids absent or if present arising from lobules
Underleaves distinct and regularly present throughout
Underleaves absent, vestigial compared to lateral leaves or rarely sporadically produced in some parts of stem
Lateral leaves and underleaves repetitively furcate and pinnately dissected into uniseriate cilia
Leaves not repetitively divided until reduced to cilia or cilia completely absent
Lateral leaves with an adaxial lobule
Lateral leaves unlobed or none of the lobes folded and resting on the other

Lateral leaves with two wings basiscopic to and attached along keel of fusion of lobule and lobe, often with additional lamellae; adaxial lobule much longer along lateral leaf lobe axis than stem axis
Lateral leaves without wings or lamellae; adaxial lobule longer along axis of stem than lateral leaf lobe or equally wide as long
Leaf cells with massive confluent trigones that occupy a similar area of leaf as cell lumens
Leaf cells without trigones or trigones small and not confluent
Stems sparingly branched, densely covered in paraphyllia; leaves 2-lobed; sporophyte developing within an ellipsoid perianth, with paraphyllia at base
Stems pinnately branched, without paraphyllia; leaves 4-lobed or bisbfid; sporophyte developing within a clavate coelocaule densely covered throughout by bracts
Lateral leaves highly crispate; lateral leaf and underleaf margins with numerous single-celled setae
Lateral leaves flat, concave or convex adaxially, not crispate; lateral leaf and underleaf margins entire, dentate or with multicellular cilia
Lateral leaves with four or more lobes or if with fewer lobes, the disc less than 10 cells long
Lateral leaves unlobed or if lobed, never with more than three lobes and disc greater than 15 cells long
Lateral leaves with two triangular lobes
Lateral leaves with three or more lobes, or with two ciliiform lobes, mostly composed of a single row of cells
Gynoecia produced on short branches without normal vegetative leaves; lateral leaves incubous, or if transverse or succubous, with at least the tips of lobes parallel to stem
Gynoecia produced on elongate stems or branches with normal vegetative leaves; lateral leaves transverse to succubous and widely spreading, the lobes spreading away from stem
Lateral leaf insertion incubous to transverse
Lateral leaf insertion succubous
Stems sparingly branched, erect or ascending; sporophyte developing within cylindric fleshy perigynium with perianth reduced to a crown of cilia or teeth at perigynium summit

Stems prostrate and repetitively furcate, with copious branching near base of leafy shoots or with leafy shoots erect from prostrate microphyllous stolon-like axes; sporophyte developing within a well-developed perianth
Gynoecia produced on elongate stems or branches with normal vegetative leaves; normal leafy stems simple or irregularly branched
Gynoecia produced on short branches without normal vegetative leaves; normal leafy stems repetitively furcate or with copious branching near base

Sporophyte produced within a well-developed perianth; branching Frullania-type or lateral-intercalary, if rarely ventral-intercalary, usually also with lateral branching; leaf cuticle smooth or with cellular spine-like projections
Sporophyte produced within a pendant subterranean marsupium covered in rhizoids; branching all ventral intercalary; leaf cuticle papillose
Lateral leaves distinctly bifid, not obviously dull-textured; underleaves deeply bifid to near base
Lateral leaves unlobed, with two apical teeth, dull-textured; underleaves undivided or shallowly bifid
Leaves with one of two leaf lobes folded and resting above the other, forming an adaxial lobule
Leaves without lobes or lobes not folded and resting above the other
Leaves with a margin formed by a row of much more elongate ovate hyaline cells devoid of oil bodies with projecting free ends
Leaves without a margin of differentiated cells or cells toward margin more hyaline but not of a drastically different form
Leaves with two approximately equal lobes a quarter or more of the length of leaf
Leaves unlobed, with more than two lobes, or if rarely with two lobes, lobes clearly unequal or less than a quarter the length of leaf
Leaves secund in direction of dorsal stem; epiphytic in rainforest
Leaves appressed to stem to widely patent, never secund; mostly terrestrial, occasionally on logs
Sporophyte only surrounded by bracts or by a reduced perianth overtopped by bracts; bracteoles absent; specialised asexual propagules absent

Perianth present and well formed, clearly exceeding bracts or rarely sporophyte developing within a marsupium; bracteoles present; asexual reproduction occasionally by gemmae produced on leaf margins near stem apices
Leaf margins decolorate or with cilia
Leaves pigmented to margins, entire or with small teeth
Stems with normal sized leaves regularly and abruptly becoming flagelliform and microphyllous
Stems not regularly becoming flagelliform and microphyllous
Leaves clearly succubously inserted; leaf cells mostly 18–45 µm in diameter, without oil bodies; female bracteoles never fused to bracts
Leaves transersely inserted or appearing to be absent; leaf cells mostly 8–14 µm in diameter, with oil bodies; at least some female bracteoles fused with bracts
Leaves opposite and narrowly connate
Leaves alternate and free
Sporophyte developing within a marsupium bearing rhizoids; oil bodies yellowish to brown when fresh, rarely hyaline
Sporophyte developing within a perianth or rarely a shoot calyptra; oil bodies hyaline
Leaf cells without trigones or if with trigones, leaf margins dentate or ciliate
Leaf cells with conspicuous trigones; leaves entire
Leaves with multiple teeth or lobed; sporophyte produced at apices of elongate leafy axes; androecia on elongate leafy axes, becoming intercalary
Leaves entire or if margins with multiple teeth then sporophyte and antheridia on short branches without normal leaves emerging from the base of leafy axes or from leafless stoloniform axes
Leaves rounded or with an acute apex, dentate or entire; stems highly branched, often differentiated into erect leafy axes and leafless creeping stolons; bracteoles present
Leaves rounded and entire; stems mostly unbranched, never with stolons; bracteoles absent
